title: Photoelectric effect- Kmax for two photons

content.question: Photons <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> of wavelength <math alttext="250 nanometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>250</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>nm</mtext></math> and <math alttext="500 nanometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>500</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>nm</mtext></mstyle></math>, respectively, are separately incident on the same metal plate. The maximum kinetic energies of electrons ejected from the plate due to the interactions with photons <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> are <math alttext="K sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="K sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, respectively. Which of the following describes the ratio <math alttext="the fraction K sub 2 over K sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
